comments.commentBody: Now we know why Trump has been vilifying the media so aggressively - he wants to instill an ever deepening distrust in the main stream media to insulate himself as the story begins to come together.  The Times, the Washington Post, and other well-respected newspapers, backed by facts and shored up with reliable sources, will take the heat until the truth finally wills out - which it always does.  It's a matter of time.
LOCK HIM UP!
More FAKE news from the desperate lefty NYTimes!

I understand that we are still awaiting the smoking gun. When did Trump order, or at least suggest, that his potential subordinates collude with Russia? We have conditions to create Russian interference according to the outgoing president's office, piecemeal conversations between Trump associates and the Russians, and an attempt to shut down an FBI investigation. Lots of sparks, wisps of smoke, but no fire.

However, never in my life has the mere question of Russian interference in the election of a US president ever been a thought, much less collusion. Additionally Trump's repetitive, and unsolicited pro-Putin and Pro-Russia remarks make this issue even more anxiety provoking. The lack of concern on the part of his supporters is frightening. Trump's message and whatever it provides the GOP and its constituents supplants the reality that one of the biggest crises in an American presidency may be have taken place.

If you wonder where these "investigations" will go, you only  need to have looked at the smug righteous face of Paul Ryan and Mike Pence during trump's speech...nodding, brow furrowing..."worried" about the state of the nation on cue, but mostly  looking over at the Democrats like " what you going to do about it?"....while trump did his best impression of an Alfred Hitchcock profile whenever he thought he wowed the crowd....hiding his dry mouth and  acute awareness that America knows a fraud when they see one.

excuse me!
at this point in time and with this information, WHY would you not have an independent investigation?????
if there is smoke, there is fire!
duh!
resolve it once and for all!!!!
nuff said!

replies.commentBody:
Who = Russia, Sessions, Flynn
What = Russian influence over the outcome of the election

How = cyber

Read the article my friend.

comments.commentBody: This article lacks who, what, where, when, how.  It's Op Ed with anonymous, i.e. no, sources or administration officials.   This is a pretty good example of "fake news".

The news that Attorney General Jeff Sessions did not tell “the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth” about his Russian contacts during his confirmation hearing marks the second time in recent history it has been revealed that a high government official apparently lied under oath before Congress.
James Clapper, the former national intelligence director, apparently lied under oath when he testified before Congress that the NSA was not collecting information on U.S. citizens. He retained his position and no action was taken.
As for Sessions, he could have provided a more nuanced answer: that he had met with the Russian ambassador in his capacity as a member of the Armed Services Committee, a claim the administration is making today, but that no campaign matters were discussed. Still that might have raised additional questions and it appears than in his office meeting with the Russian ambassador, the campaign might have been discussed.
Whatever the outcome, it appears that the ability of Congress to get honest answers from those who come before it and testify under oath has been compromised, a victim of national security concerns and Russian meddling in our election.

Stop blowing the Russia story out of proportion to cover up the pedogate scandal so the AG cannot investigate the real criminals in high places Obama team should have spent their time and money on dismantling the large network of pedophiles in politics. The truth is coming out anyway the victims are releasing videos on YouTube its going to be bigger than the catholic church scandal if you dont stop the cover ups usual lies #pizzagate #pedogate

They wait to the very end of the article to admit that the only real communication was from Flynn when he told Russia please do not retaliate against sanctions. These Patriots did not want to go to war with Russia like the fake liberal neocon warmongers in the Democrat Party who are all elements of the military industrial complex, along with their partners the 'RINOs' in the Republican Party

The Russians should be celebrated for exposing the Podesta emails like a whistle blower.   We saw how it took ten people days to decide exactly how HRC should answer a question. Who wants a fake person like that as the leader of the free world.

Trump supporters have put this country in the hands of a man with no moral compass who is supported by similar Republicans with loyalty to their party and not to the country. Ryan is a sorry individual who just wants to pass his personal legislative priorities with no consideration for the country.
The need to stay in power by the parties that dominate the US has resulted in corruption beyond the norm. Some changes may help reduce the rivalry and the attitude of the Republicans who feel that the party is more important than the country.
1. Eliminate the Electoral College.
2. Allow any party member to vote for the candidate who stands for election by ordering their choice using 1, 2, 3 etc. This would be a real democratic choice and not bound by any party affiliation.
3. The Federal government role is important where there are conflicts of interest between the state and the rest of the country. So allow the Federal laws to stay and not become state priorities. Slavery would have continued if the states were allowed to decide the issue.
I hope the Trump supporters and the Republicans see the folly of their choices and think of the country and not their personal interests. Libertarians must be exposed to the lawless and in-disciplined ways of some Democracies like India before they decide to vote for nuts like Johnson.

Very bizarre that the NYT would resort to this level of journalism without clear proof of Trump involvement and specific details about that involvement. This article includes very zero factual information and much speculation and unattributed accusations.

I am disheartened that the NYT has become the mirror image of Fox News. Nothing they report can be considered credible.

I do not understand why this article was even published. When and if they have information about collusion between the Trump administration and Russia, then and only then does it become news.

Bigger news might be that Sessions talked with the Chinese ambassador or even worse the Germans...........

"The revelation prompted congressional Democrats to issue a torrent of statements reiterating their demands that Mr. Sessions recuse himself from overseeing any investigation into Russia’s contacts with the Trump campaign. So far, Mr. Sessions has demurred."

Demurred? In this context, what the heck does that mean? The Times has chosen one of the vaguest words in the dictionary. Did he refuse directly to recuse himself? Or did he refuse to comment on whether he would recuse himself? Or did he say he was thinking about it? Or did he say nobody has the right to ask the question? If he unilaterally refused to recuse himself, instead of saying demurred, why don't you just say refused? If this is the new tiptoeing around words that might anger the administration, that's very bad news.
Bengazi, Bengazi, Bengazi... the republicans would not let us forget that fiasco. It should now be Russia, Russia,Russia...
I wonder how many fingers they can put in the dike before the whole thing goes, and then, ironically, Donald will have drained his own swamp :)

Is anyone OK with giving the United States Attorney General a pass on lying twice under oath before a Congressional Committee?  If we're willing to accept that, then we might as well just dissolve the Republic and start over with something else entirely.
Sessions lied under oath.  LOCK HIM UP!
